oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gebrauch biologischer Insektizide im Kampf gegen den Scaphoideus titanus, den Vektor von Flavescence dorée
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jermini, Mauro
Gusberti, Michele
Trivellone, Valeria
Wyss, Erich
Linder, Christian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Flavescence dorée and the mandatory control of its vector Scaphoideus titanus pose important problems in organic vineyards. The goal of our field studies conducted in the Ticino was to develop a pest control strategy conform to the guidelines of organic production. Insecticides containing pyrethrin were the only organic products showing an efficacy higher than 90% against the immature stages of S. titanus. However, these products had no effect on adult leafhoppers. Repeated applications of pyrethrin proved to be toxic against the predatory mite species Amblyseius andersoni. Despite this toxicity, the only efficient and recommended control strategy in organic vineyards is their application. Pyrethrin should be applied three times at an interval of ten days after the first appearance of individuals of the 3rd nymphal stage. Symptomatic plants must be eradicated from the vineyard to remove the phytoplasma inoculum.
